alert.note: Alert for Central Plaquemines; Coastal Jefferson; Eastern Orleans; Lower Jefferson; Lower Plaquemines; Lower St. Bernard; St. Charles; Upper Jefferson; Upper Lafourche; Upper Plaquemines; Upper St. Bernard; Western Orleans (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 7:43PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of St. Bernard, eastern St. Charles, Orleans, northeastern Lafourche, Jefferson and northwestern Plaquemines Parishes through 830 PM CDT... At 741 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles south of Avondale to near Shell Beach. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Orleans, Chalmette, Avondale, Metairie, Marrero, Harvey, East New Orleans, Timberlane, Belle Chasse, Port Sulphur, Jefferson, Gretna, Harahan, Westwego, Jean Lafitte, Luling, Poydras, River Ridge, Myrtle Grove and Ama. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 217 and 249. Interstate 310 between mile markers 1 and 7. Interstate 510 between mile markers 1 and 3. Interstate 610 between mile markers 1 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
